translated: Dependent on a visible-data-object that is both object-of-consciousness and has impingement there arises a visible-data-object that is both object-of-consciousness and has impingement which is not associated with consciousness.🔽With respect to root cause twenty-one, with respect to predominance twenty-one,

(In brief.) With a root as condition, twenty-one. With predominance as condition, twenty-one. … With mutuality as condition, three. … With non-disappearance as condition, twenty-one.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nacittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho cittasaṁsaṭṭho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) translated: With object-impression-visible-non-conjoined-with-cognizance as condition, object-impression-invisible-non-cognizance-conjoined-with-cognizance arises through the condition being a root. (In brief.) With a root as condition, three. … With non-disappearance as condition, three.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nocittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham no citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ

(In brief.)

original: cittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekavīsa, ārammaṇe
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe
translated: A mind-produced idea arises with mind-consciousness as condition. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, twenty-one. With object as condition,

original: tīṇi …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: three. … With non-hindrance as condition, twenty-one.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanocittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho nocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nocittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho cittasahabhū🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na sanidassana sappaṭigham na no citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sa nidassana sa paṭigham no citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca a nidassana appaṭighaḥ citta sahabhū  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: With a visible-form that is a condition, a non-visible-form that is not a mind-product arises. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, three. … With non-hindrance as condition, three.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanocittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na no citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: With a visible-form that is not a mind-concomitant, a non-visible-form that is a mind-concomitant arises. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, five. With object as condition, three. … With non-hindrance as condition, five.

original: nocittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekavīsa, ārammaṇe
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe
translated: With a visible-form that is a mind-concomitant, a non-visible-form that is not a mind-concomitant arises. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, twenty-one. With object as condition,

original: tīṇi …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: three. … With non-hindrance as condition, twenty-one.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nocittānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa ppaṭigham no citta anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca a nidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With a condition that is supramundane and has a counterpart, and is not a mental concomitant, a condition that is supramundane and has no counterpart,

analyzed: citta anuparivattī dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe
translated: and is a mental concomitant arises. (In brief:) With a condition that is a root, five. With a condition that is an object,

original: tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: three. … With a condition that is not-hindrance, five.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanocittānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na no citta anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: With a condition that is supramundane and has a counterpart, and is not a mental concomitant, a condition that is supramundane and has no counterpart,

analyzed: no citta anuparivattī dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe
translated: and is a mental concomitant arises. (In brief:) With a condition that is a root, twenty-one. With a condition that is an object,

analyzed: tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: three. … With a condition that is not-hindrance, twenty-one.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa ppaṭigham no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With a condition that is supramundane and has a counterpart, and is not associated with thought, a condition that is supramundane and has no counterpart,

original: cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: and is associated with thought arises. (In brief:) With a condition that is a root, three. … With a condition that is not-hindrance, three.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: na sanidassana sappaṭigham na no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ
translated: With a condition that is supramundane and has a counterpart, and is not associated with thought, a condition that is supramundane and has no counterpart,🔽and is associated with thought arises. (In brief:) With a condition that is a root, twenty-one. With a condition that is an object,🔽three. … With a condition that is not-hindrance, twenty-one.

original: nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekavīsa,
analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekavīsa
translated: A state that is not a product of mind-contact arises … (In brief:) … with root-cause as condition, twenty-one.

original: ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate ekavīsa.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa  na sa nidassana sa ppaṭigham no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum dhammam paṭicca a nidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With object as condition, three … With non-adhesion as condition, twenty-one.

original: cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhū dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: With a state that is visible and has impingement and is a product of a great element that is not a product of mind-contact as condition, a state that is invisible, has impingement, and is a product of a great element that is a co-nascent condition of mind-contact arises … (In brief:) … with root-cause as condition,

original: tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sanidassana sappaṭigham na no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum dhammam paṭicca sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ
translated: three … with non-adhesion as condition, three.

original: nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhū dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: With a state that is visible and has impingement and is not a product of a great element that is a product of mind-contact as condition, a state that is visible and has impingement and is not a product of a great element that is a co-nascent condition of mind-contact arises … (In brief:) … with root-cause as condition,

original: ekavīsa, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: ekavīsa ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: twenty-one … with object as condition, three … with non-adhesion as condition, twenty-one.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa ppaṭigham no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With a state that is visible and has impingement and is not a product of a great element that is a postnascent condition of a great element that is a product of mind-contact as condition, a state that is invisible, has impingement, and is a product of a great element that is a prenascent condition of mind-contact arises …

original: cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattī dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā
translated: A state that is a concomitant of what is associated with mind and originates from mind arises with mind as condition by way of a condition being a root. (In brief.) As root cause there are three … (and so on as in § 1 up to:) as object there are three … as non-hindrance there are three.

original: tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽sanidassanasappaṭigho nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sani dassana sa ppaṭigham na no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca  no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattī dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is not supramundane and is a concomitant of what is supramundane and originates from what is supramundane arises with a supramundane state as condition by way of a condition being a root. (In brief.) As root cause there are three … as object there are three … as non-hindrance there are three.🔽A state that is not supramundane and is a concomitant of what is supramundane and originates from what is supramundane arises with a supramundane state as condition by way of a condition being a root. (In brief.) As root cause there are three … as object there are three … as non-hindrance there are three.

translated: there are eighteen; with respect to the unincluded, there are eighteen.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naanupādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho anupādinno
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na anupādinnam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ anupādinnaḥ

original: …pe… magge vippayutte atthiyā avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: pe magge vippayutte atthiyā avigate ekavīsa
